alert.note: Alert for Pottawattamie (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 07 at 10:01PM CDT until May 08 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT FOR EASTERN POTTAWATTAMIE COUNTY... At 1001 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles east of Hancock, or 10 miles west of Atlantic, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Public. These storms have a history of producing quarter sized hail near Walnut. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Pottawattamie County, including the following locations... Botna Bend Park and Farm Creek Public Wildlife Area. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
